title: When a certain number is subtracted from twice another number, the result is 6. When four times the first is added to twice second number, the result is 26. What are the two numbers? - Quora

response.answer_text: When a certain number is subtracted from twice another number, the result is 6. 2x - y = 6 When four times the first is added to twice second number, the result is 26. 2x + 4y = 26 -> 8x - 4y = 24 2x + 4y + 8x - 4y = 26 + 24 10x = 50 x = 5 10 - y = 6 10 - 6 = y y = 4 The numbers are 4 and 5.
2b-a=6 . . . (1) 4a+2b=26 . . . (2) Subtracting (1) from (2) we get : 5a=20 Therefore a=4 and b=5
